cocktails.name: Mojito
recipe: Muddle mint leaves and lime in a glass.
Add simple syrup and white rum.
Top up with soda water and stir.
Add ice cubes and garnish with a mint sprig.
cocktails.history: The Mojito is a traditional Cuban cocktail that dates back to the 16th century.

cocktails.name: Martini
recipe: Chill the glass by placing it in the freezer or filling it with ice water.
In a mixing glass, combine gin and dry vermouth with ice.
Stir or shake well, then strain into the chilled glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or olive.
cocktails.history: The Martini is a classic cocktail with disputed origins, believed to have originated in the late 19th century.

cocktails.name: Margarita
recipe: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime wedge to moisten it.
Dip the rim in salt to coat it.
In a shaker with ice, combine tequila, triple sec, and lime juice.
Shake well and strain into the glass over ice.
cocktails.history: The Margarita is a popular Mexican cocktail with a disputed origin, possibly dating back to the 1930s.

cocktails.name: Old Fashioned
recipe: Place the sugar cube in a glass and saturate it with bitters.
Muddle the sugar and bitters together.
Add a large ice cube and pour the whiskey over it.
Stir gently and garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.history: The Old Fashioned is a classic cocktail that dates back to the early 19th century.

cocktails.name: Negroni
recipe: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour equal parts gin, sweet vermouth, and Campari over the ice.
Stir well and garnish with an orange slice or twist.
cocktails.history: The Negroni is an Italian cocktail that originated in Florence, Italy, in the early 20th century.

cocktails.name: Cosmopolitan
recipe: Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add vodka, triple sec, cranberry juice, and lime juice to the shaker.
Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.history: The Cosmopolitan gained popularity in the 1990s and is often associated with cosmopolitan cities like New York.

cocktails.name: Whiskey Sour
recipe: Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add whiskey, simple syrup, and lemon juice to the shaker.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with an orange slice or cherry.
cocktails.history: The Whiskey Sour is a classic cocktail that dates back to the mid-19th century.

cocktails.name: Daiquiri
recipe: Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add white rum, simple syrup, and lime juice to the shaker.
Shake well and strain into a chilled martini or coupe glass.
cocktails.history: The Daiquiri is a classic Cuban cocktail that gained popularity in the early 20th century.

cocktails.name: Piña Colada
ingredients: pineapple slice and maraschino cherry for garnish
recipe: Fill a blender with ice cubes.
Add white rum, coconut cream, and pineapple juice to the blender.
Blend until smooth and pour into a chilled glass.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and maraschino cherry.
cocktails.history: The Piña Colada is a tropical cocktail that originated in Puerto Rico in the 1950s.

cocktails.name: Gin and Tonic
recipe: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour gin over the ice and top up with tonic water.
Stir gently and garnish with a lime wedge or slice.
cocktails.history: The Gin and Tonic is a classic cocktail that originated in British colonial India as a way to mask the bitter taste of quinine in tonic water.

cocktails.name: Mai Tai
recipe: Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add light rum, dark rum, lime juice, orgeat syrup, and orange liqueur to the shaker.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.
cocktails.history: The Mai Tai is a tiki cocktail that originated in the 1940s and gained popularity in tiki bars.

cocktails.name: Strawberry Margarita
recipe: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime wedge to moisten it.
Dip the rim in salt to coat it.
In a shaker with ice, combine tequila, triple sec, lime juice, and strawberry puree.
Shake well and strain into the glass over ice.
Garnish with fresh strawberries.
cocktails.history: A fruity variation of the classic Margarita, the Strawberry Margarita is perfect for summer gatherings.

cocktails.name: Blue Lagoon
recipe: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour vodka and blue curaçao over the ice.
Top up with lemonade and stir gently.
Garnish with a lemon slice and a maraschino cherry.
cocktails.history: The Blue Lagoon is a vibrant and refreshing cocktail known for its striking blue color.

cocktails.name: Peach Bellini
recipe: Add peach puree to a chilled champagne flute.
Top up with Prosecco and stir gently.
cocktails.history: The Peach Bellini is a classic Italian cocktail made with peach puree and Prosecco.
